notes.2:
+	Addition	5 + 2 = 7                      also one more thing i changed the practice exercise today to just perform operations on numbers

-	Subtraction	4 - 2 = 2
*	Multiplication	2 * 3 = 6
/	Division	4 / 2 = 2
//	Floor Division	10 // 3 = 3
%	Modulo	5 % 2 = 1
**	Power	4 ** 2 = 16
=	Assignment Operator	a = 7
+=	Addition Assignment	a += 1 # a = a + 1
-=	Subtraction Assignment	a -= 3 # a = a - 3
*=	Multiplication Assignment	a *= 4 # a = a * 4
/=	Division Assignment	a /= 3 # a = a / 3
%=	Remainder Assignment	a %= 10 # a = a % 10
**=	Exponent Assignment	a **= 10 # a = a ** 10
==	Is Equal To	3 == 5 gives us False
!=	Not Equal To	3 != 5 gives us True
>	Greater Than	3 > 5 gives us False
<	Less Than	3 < 5 gives us True
>=	Greater Than or Equal To	3 >= 5 give us False
<=	Less Than or Equal To	3 <= 5 gives us True
is 	=True if the operands are identical (refer to the same object)	x is True
is not =	True if the operands are not identical (do not refer to the same object)
in	True if value/variable is found in the sequence	5 in x
not in	True if value/variable is not found in the sequence
 a if block is something that happens if and if the if block is not executed it will execute the else block
Elif means else if and is used It is used when you have multiple conditions to check after an if statement.
and means both of them have to be true but or means that only one of them has to be true
if you want a user to enter something use this command num1 = float(input("Enter first number: ")) if they are not entering a number just remove the float
